channel.title: [Tut]~How To Delete an Undeletable File~[Tut]
channel.description:
Open a Command Prompt window and leave it open. Close all open programs. Click Start, Run and enter TASKMGR.EXE Go to the Processes tab and End Process on Explorer.exe. Leave Task Manager open. Go back to the Command Prompt window and change to the directory the AVI (or other undeletable file) is located in. At the command prompt type DEL <filename> where <filename> is the file you wish to delete. Go back to Task Manager, click File, New Task and enter EXPLORER.EXE to restart the GUI shell. Close Task Manager.
Tweaker~

item.title: [Tut]~How To Delete an Undeletable File~[Tut]
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

How to actually delete an undelete file:

  1. Close any processes using it.
  2. Try using del /F
  3. Steal ownership rights, niggah.
  4. Download cygwin and use rm -rf yoh.

The stealing ownership rights hax is critical for deleting remnants of botched windowsupdates etc, they will hang around, even after you reinstall windows, refusing to be deleted.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut]~How To Delete an Undeletable File~[Tut]
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“rob1601, post:8, topic:58461”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=83752.msg900430#msg900430 date=1171498744]
Or, just get Unlocker. (It’s a great program, everyone should get it)

And anyway, explorer.exe isn’t always the one with the handle on the file. Unlocker will find the process which has the file locked, and will remove the handle(s), it won’t even get out of the process! <3
[/quote]

that dont always remove corruped files.[/quote]

That made absolutely no sense. Clarify?

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut]~How To Delete an Undeletable File~[Tut]
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

exps35:

Move on Boot does the same thing. And if you know where a virus is, you can delete files that say “can’t delete because the file is in use” etc.

No, Unlocker removes the handle on the file in REALTIME. If that doesn’t work (very rare) it deletes the file on the next restart (like MoveOnBoot).

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut]~How To Delete an Undeletable File~[Tut]
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Or, just get Unlocker. (It’s a great program, everyone should get it)

And anyway, explorer.exe isn’t always the one with the handle on the file. Unlocker will find the process which has the file locked, and will remove the handle(s), it won’t even get out of the process! <3

Read full topic
